title: Can GUI elements of a running program be found/located in memory?
content: Is it possible for a particular GUI element of a running program (on Windows platform) to be located in memory, such as a text element from a dialog box? For example, locating title text of a drop-down menu or text within an "About" popup box.

comments.text: Have You Tried the FindWindow ,EnumWindiws,,getwindowtext functions

answers_data.content:
There Are Many Apis that can help you locate the pertinent windows the simplest being FindWindow And GetWindowText you can run a complete enumeration with EnumWindows using A user provided callback function these are the for programming part

if you need a readymade option you can look for tools like spy++ that comes with visual studio or many other Gui Spy Programs ( I tend to use winspy++ from catch22.net )
